column2: Those in the Central Provinces always look to the north to the grandstanding of my sister at the Great Bastion. Meanwhile, I must marshall the Burning Winds, defend our borders against the Nagas and serpents of Khuresh, keep peace with the tigers of Ind, and war with the Monkey King's legions that come down from the Mountains of Heaven. \n - Li Dao
Reing of the Witch King of Naggaroth
The Parasitic maggot lord has found himself with out an body.
The Maggot Lord approaches you menancingly...
I Shall Feast on you Today...
You approach [target_character.GetFullName] with intent to decide consume his body into your being...
I shall make your body mine
You wake in the morning in cold sweat looking feeling nauseus. upon closer inspection you notice your body has become an host to swarm of maggots, truly an ominous sight...
Cut them out! CUT THEM OUT!
The Maggots in your body have started taking toll on your mental fortitude telling you to do things you normally would not do enstranging your family any friends in process...
Your mind finally crumbles, and new consience becomes apparent. You have finally achieved the total control of this body it is time to enact your plans...
Your Host body has crumbled to unuseable form... it is time to find a new host you must act quickly...
You start noticing your skin color starting to look pale and your body no longer generates as fast as it used to...
Your body has started visibly rotting but it still manages to regenate itself through dark magics.
Your body is at it's breaking point no longer regenerating and small parts of your body are already starting to fall off... you might need to start looking for a new host.
CURSES! your body no longer is capable of sustaining it self and has finally fully collapsed...
The maggots have deeply ingrained onto your body refusing to leave it, you can only surmise this does not mean anything good for your health...
The skaven clans structure themselves how ever they wish at all times to represent the needs of their clan leader.
This clan Partakes in scavenging the dead in any battle field they can find on the surface and the underground to strenghten their coffers.
This clan Prides themselves in their elite warriors first and foremost.
This clan is filled with cowardly skaven to the brim to maximize their numbers.

So far governing our lands within [Root.GetRootColonyArea] have been an impossible task and our inaction to appoint an governor has seen a rise of an local magisterate to raise onto effective power of that of an governor.
The territories around quetza was heavily ravaged by the concoctions of the Clan Pestilence and the Daemon Prince of Nurgle during the Pestilence's incursion long time ago...
Ever since its fall, Mousillon is a cursed, impoverished land that is plagued by constant misfortunes, disease and drawing the attention of dark powers.
Staff made out of glassy rock of obsinite.
The crystal protects those who worship the Serpent God, healing wounds and bringing supplicants back from the point of death.

Viewed up close, this small black cube contains millions of tiny pin-pricks of blinking light, each circling a sphere of pure darkness. By implementing the correct pattern of thoughts, the cube may be opened for a fraction of a second, inexplicably drawing the very Winds of Magic into its depths.

Cut from the plague-ridden hide of a Plague Pontifex personally slain by Chief Poqenichi himself, it was crafted when the fork-tailed comet lit even the daytime sky, and many blessings of the Serpent God have been put upon the vile hide.
Shield made out of Scales of various saurians found within the jungles and bronze.
Blade made out of volcanic glass called obsinite.

Legends carved on ancient stone claim the blade exists on every plane of reality simultaneously, and that its edge can sever a creature’s soul. No earthly force can stop this deadly blade — it penetrates granite and steel as easily as it slices through flesh and bone.

The finely woven Cloak of Feathers is made from hundreds of shed feathers gathered over the centuries from one of the most rare creatures to inhabit Lustria — the mysterious Coatl, inheriting their portion mystical powers.
armor made out of Obsinite stone plates adourned in manner of prophetic plaques of the old ones.
The children of the Old Ones do not forge iron like other mortal races, typically beating and coldworking softer metals into armor instead.

This weapon was said to have been wielded by the warlike Old One deity Tlanxla as he rode his sky chariot into battle. It hums with ancient energy, and those struck by it are overcome by doom-laden visions that sap their will to fight.

Great hunting cats, cannibalistic monkey-kin, and the buzzing swarms of enormous insect life makes the jungle a constant battle zone, where survival is an hourly struggle, yet most dangerous of all that hunt beneath the canopies are the giant reptiles. Your monthly excursions of into the jungles in search of prey have finally caught up in form of one of the most dreaded reptiles...

Subfeudation is the practice by which a King, or other superior lord, allow vassals to carve out new and distinct tenures in their turn by sub-letting or alienating a part of their lands to tenants. This Dukedom shows utmost respect and loyalty for the Realm and the Royarch and will strive to aid them whatever way possible.

Subfeudation is the practice by which a King, or other superior lord, allow vassals to carve out new and distinct tenures in their turn by sub-letting or alienating a part of their lands to tenants. This Dukedom shows disunity and stagnation towards the realm be it due to dislike of the Royarch or disputes with the Royalist Faction.
The egg opens and withered Quango hatchling marches on wards feebly biting the nearby enemy troops to no avail.
A Quango hatchling emerges from within to charge at the enemy with vigour before succumbing and being overwhelmed by the enemy.
The heavens resound to thunderous peals as Quango bursts forth in full glory and casts its radiant hues upon the world. after smiting it's foes, it flies off, taking no further in battle.
Long standing Royal Trading guild Ran by the Merchants of Marienburg creating Profits for the Local Lord.

Greatest City in Norsca and the city that hosts the majestic treasures of High Kings of the old.Buildings and its protective walls in Heorot are made of the distinctive and durable blue-grey rock found only in the mountains north of the city.
A Slave state managed by greenskins who rely on the Dawi Zharr for patronage and protection in order to maximize production and profits from the slaves present.
Become Part of Council of Thirteen
Show-off and make-kill room in Council of Thirteen for your conniving-fitting self...
Have 5 Neighbouring Skaven Culture Group Tributaries
Establish colonial rule on farflung provinces of your empire to soften the governmental stress.
The Lady has forseen new lands for our peasants to till upon the horizon. time to send thine peasant's to work for the glory of the lady!
Embrace local customs of the settlers.
Medidate where the Winds of Magic flow the strongest to gain Insight.
Medidate where the winds of Chaos flow the strongest to gain Insight.
Corrupt local magical flow to further the chaotic winds of magic.
Restore Place of Power to Control the chaotic winds of magic better.
